sources.data_found: Tillicum: NVIDIA H200 GPUs with ultra-fast NVLink 4.0 interconnect and a 400 Gbps InfiniBand network
Hyak GPU node options available for purchase: 32-cores, 384GB, 2 x L40 GPUs (w/48GB per card); 16-cores, 192GB, 2 x H50 (w/40GB per card); 32-cores, 384GB, 2 x H100 (w/80GB per card)
KLONE cluster launched in spring 2021 with 144 HPC nodes and 192 GPUs. In just a single year, grown to over 384 HPC nodes and 448 GPUs
The size of the undergraduate program has risen rapidly, more than tripling from 558 students in 2012 to 1,996 in 2021. In 2022, the Allen School had a total of 1,930 undergraduates majors
In 2023, Computer Science awarded 495 bachelor's degrees. In 2021, University of Washington-Seattle Campus handed out 494 bachelor's degrees in computer science
549 Total Graduate Students; 2,456 Applied, 218 Accepted, 113 Enrolled
Each year, the Allen School welcomes around 60 new students interested in pursuing advanced academic or industry research careers to our Ph.D. program

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count (1930) from Wikipedia based on 2022 data. Graduate student total (549) from Peterson's includes both MS and PhD students. PhD count estimated at 300 based on the statement that Allen School welcomes 60 new PhD students per year and typical 5-year PhD duration (60 × 5 = 300)

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Available for purchase as 2x L40 GPU nodes for Hyak
Available for purchase as 2x H50 GPU nodes for Hyak
Mentioned in Hyak documentation but no total count found

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts are challenging to determine precisely. The Hyak Klone cluster had 448 GPUs total as of 2022 (grown from 192 in 2021). Specific models available include H100 (available as 2x H100 node configurations), L40, H50, and Tesla P100. Tillicum cluster has H200 GPUs but exact count not specified. The H100 count of 16 represents minimum confirmed (8 nodes × 2 GPUs based on available purchase configurations). Actual counts across all UW systems are likely significantly higher but not publicly documented with specificity.

analysis_notes: Data collected via systematic web searches. GPU infrastructure at UW consists of multiple systems: (1) Hyak Klone cluster with 448+ GPUs including H100, L40, H50, and legacy models; (2) New Tillicum cluster with H200 GPUs; (3) Research Computing Club provides GPU access to students. Total GPU counts are underestimated as specific model breakdowns were not publicly available for the full 448+ GPU inventory.
